Description: Foot of possibly Attic pottery cup-skyphos or similar; interior: glazed black; exterior: reserved at join of wall and foot; edge of foot black; underside: reserved with incised head of a satyr and inscription.
Curator's comments: The shape of this piece is very difficult to parallel, perhaps the Laconian mug being closest, though the fabric seems rather Attic.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (F607)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 86, pl. XVII, no. 3)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 694, no. 515)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0732) (Phase 1)
